title: How to Make Good Habits Inevitable and Bad Habits Impossible
summary: Commitment devices are choices you make in the present that lock in better behavior in the future. By using technology, automation, and one-time choices, you can make good habits inevitable and bad habits impossible. The ultimate way to lock in future behavior is to make it automatic.
keyIdeas: Commitment devices lock in future behavior in the present.
Make good habits inevitable through automation and one-time choices.
Make bad habits impossible by removing your ability to perform them.
Technology can automate good habits and block bad ones.
One-time choices can have lasting positive effects.
The best way to break a bad habit is to make it impossible.
Design your future by making commitments in the present.
examples: Use an app to automatically transfer money to savings each month.
Delete social media apps to make mindless scrolling impossible.
Sign up for automatic bill payments to never miss a payment.
Use a website blocker during work hours to prevent distraction.
exercises: Identify one commitment device you could use for a good habit.
Make one bad habit impossible by removing your ability to do it.
Automate one habit using technology or a one-time choice.
reflections: What good habit could you make inevitable with a commitment device?
What bad habit could you make impossible by changing your environment?
